law_name: THE INTERNATIONAL MONETARY FUND AND BANK ACT

sections.body: (1) This Act may be called the International Monetary Fund and Bank Act, 1950. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force on such date as the Federal Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint.

sections.section_title: Payment to International Fund and Bank
sections.body: (1) There shall be paid out of the revenues of the Federal Government all such sums as may from time to time be required for the purpose of paying (a) the subscriptions payable by the Federal Government to the International Fund and to the International Bank; (b) any sums payable by the Federal Government to the International Fund and to the International Bank; (c) any charges payable by the Federal Government to the International Fund; (d) any sums required for implementing the guarantee of the Federal Government referred to in section 3 of Article XIII of the Fund Agreement; (e) any compensation required to be paid by the Federal Government to the International Fund or to any member thereof; (f) any charges or assessment payable by the Federal Government to the International Fund. (2) The Federal Government may create and issue to the International Fund or International Bank, in such form as it thinks fit, any such non-interest bearing and non-negotiable notes or other obligations. (3) Any funds required on account of certain payments shall be provided by the Federal Government from out of a special deposit account to be maintained by it with the State Bank of Pakistan.

sections.section_title: State Bank to be depository for International Fund and Bank
sections.body: The State Bank of Pakistan shall be the depository of the Pakistan currency holdings of the International Fund and International Bank.

(1) Where under section 5 of Article VIII of the Fund Agreement, the International Fund required the Federal Government to furnish it with any information, the Federal Government, or if authorized, the State Bank may require any person to furnish such detailed information. (2) Every officer or person to whom any information is required to be furnished shall be deemed to be a public servant. (3) No information obtained under this section shall be furnished to the International Fund in such detail as to disclose the affairs of any person. (4) A determination of the Federal Government or the State Bank as to the extent of detail in which information is to be furnished shall be final.

sections.section_title: Certain provisions of Agreements to have force of law
sections.body: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any other law, the provisions of the Fund and Bank Agreements set out in the Schedule shall have the force of law in Pakistan.

sections.section_title: Special drawing rights not to be taxed
sections.body: No tax of any kind shall be levied on special drawing rights or on operations or transactions in special drawing rights.
